Line 65: Line 65:
[[Google Desktop]] is a service that brings the search engine to the local computer desktop, allowing one to search individual files, folders, and emails that reside locally on one's own PC.
[[Google Desktop]] is a service that brings the search engine to the local computer desktop, allowing one to search individual files, folders, and emails that reside locally on one's own PC.
â
[[2006]] saw the dawn of a number of new services, such as [[Google Page Creator]] (an easy to use, [[WYSIWYG]] webpage creator), [[Google Calendar]] (a shared-calendaring application), [[Google Spreadsheets]] (an application for editing of spreadsheets online), [[Google Notebook]] (a tool permitting users to clip text, images, and links from web pages while browsing, save them online, access them from any computer, and share them with others), and ''Google Apps for Your Domain'' (a combination of [[Gmail]], [[Google Calendar]], [[Google Talk]], and [[Google Page Creator]] into a single offering targeted to small businesses and educational institutions <ref>Needleman, Rafe. "[http://reviews.zdnet.co.uk/0,39023100,39281962,00.htm Google Apps for Your Domain]." ''[[ZDNet]].'' [[August 29]], [[2006]]. Retrieved on [[August 31]], [[2006]]</ref>).
+
[[2006]] saw the dawn of a number of new services, such as [[Google Page Creator]] (an easy to use, [[WYSIWYG]] webpage creator), [[Google Calendar]] (a shared-calendaring application), [[Google Spreadsheets]] (an application for editing of spreadsheets online), [[Google Notebook]] (a tool permitting users to clip text, images, and links from web pages while browsing, save them online, access them from any computer, and share them with others), and ''Google Apps for Your Domain'' (a combination of [[Gmail]], [[Google Calendar]], [[Google Talk]], and [[Google Page Creator]] into a single offering targeted to small businesses and educational institutions <ref>Needleman, Rafe. "[http://reviews.zdnet.co.uk/0,39023100,39281962,00.htm Google Apps for Your Domain]." ''[[ZDNet]].'' [[August 29]], [[2006]]. Retrieved on [[August 31]], [[2006]]</ref>). [[Google SketchUp]] was also released in 2006, and was promoted as working with [[Google Earth]].
[[2006]] also saw the introduction of [[Google Code]] - Project Hosting, a [[Subversion]]-based [[source code]] and [[bug tracker]] as a direct competitor to [[SourceForge]].
[[2006]] also saw the introduction of [[Google Code]] - Project Hosting, a [[Subversion]]-based [[source code]] and [[bug tracker]] as a direct competitor to [[SourceForge]].
